meta.title: Golden Retriever Hip Dysplasia & Mobility Issues
meta.description: Hip dysplasia is common in Golden Retrievers. Learn the signs, treatments, and how to support your dog's joint health.

h1: Hip Mobility Issues in Golden Retrievers
overview: Hip dysplasia is a genetic condition prevalent in Goldens. It causes joint laxity, pain, and eventually arthritis. Early management is key.
symptoms: Reluctance to jump or climb stairs

solutions.title: Weight Management
solutions.description: Keeping your dog lean reduces stress on joints significantly.

solutions.title: Joint Supplements
solutions.description: Glucosamine and Chondroitin help maintain cartilage health.

solutions.title: Low-Impact Exercise
solutions.description: Swimming is excellent for building muscle without joint strain.
